titleStmt.title: E. Coghill et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8695

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Honbl. James F Robinson
Governor of Kentucky
The undersigned your petitioner would respectfully state that at the Aug term 1862 of the Carroll Circuit Court John Dugan was fined twenty Dollars for tippling.

We state that said Dugan is a miner about fifteen years old that his brother was selling liquer with out license, that on one occasion only he waited on a customer of his brother during his brothers absence and for this he was fined
Your petitioner believing this case desires executive clemency prays that said fine may be remitted

E Coghill
Wm Owen
Wm Darling
H W Pryor
Wm Gardner
A R Gaunt
John J. Orr
Allen Hanks
Allen Donaldson
Benjamin Elston
J H Masterson
W L Ringo
L, W, Taylor
D W Wogin
G M Fisher
Jno R Vance
J M Collyn
B B Elston
Jas. K. Pope
Joseph Ringo
John Hogan late clk
H C C C
P. O. Turpin
Geo Ringo
H. H. Turpin
R, Cufemt
R. I. Voue
R. J. Wilson
Joe. C. Scott
T. J. Jenkins
Richd Johnston
W H Van Pell

Carroll Cir Ct
Jno Dugan Pettn
$20. } Tipling
One half fine remitted in this case

J F Robinson
Issd Feby 19. 1863
to Mr Vanpell
